entry.title: Full Fledge Guide on TLD's - What is Top Level Domain(s)
entry.content:
Top level domain which is also abbrebiated as TLD is the very last segment of any domain name, every domain’s last part is simply called as TLD. The TLD is the letters immediately following the final dot in an Internet address i.e. any website url, for Instance in Harkuchh.com here .com is TLD of generic class (we will talk about TLD classes below). Most generally TLD is use to identifies something about a website is associated with, like its purpose, the organization that owns it or the geographical area from where it has originates, and every type of TLD has a different registry which is being maintained by a designated organization the Internet Assigned Numbers Authority (IANA) under the direction of ICANN i.e. The Internet Corporation for Assigned Names and Numbers.

To better understand TLD see our Internet address which is, http://Harkuchh.com now here com is the top-level domain name and Harkuchh is the second-level domain name and if a domain has anything even before second level domain then it is called as a subdomain. When these all merge together they build a fully qualified domain name (FQDN) the addition of HTTP:// makes an FQDN a complete URL.

Four (4) major categories of TLDs

Generic top-level domains (gTLD) — These are the most used, common and familiar type of TLDs. Examples include “com” for “commercial”, “org” for “organization” and “edu” for “educational.” Most generic TLDs are open for everyone to register, but there is a subgroup that is more strictly controlled and that is not used broadly.

Country-code top-level domains (ccTLD) — Each ccTLD identifies a particular country and every ccTLD is two letters long, for example we can see the ccTLD for India is .in and for United States is .us.

Infrastructure top-level domain — This type is very often used class of TLD may be that is the reason there is only one TLD in this group, ARPA (Address and Routing Parameter Area). The Internet Assigned Numbers Authority (IANA) manages this TLD for the IETF.

Sponsored top-level domains (sTLD): These are overseen by private organizations.

ICANN Proposed an expansion of the TLD system to allow anyone to register and also reserve any spare unused letter sequence as a TLD for Their exclusive use, in April 2009. For example if a company who use to sell sotwares want to to use .Soft as a TLD then they can use it. According to ICANN chief executive Paul Levins, Such an extension would lead to thousands of new TLDs in the coming years.

entry.title: How to use Google like a pro: Tips to use Google syntax
entry.content:
I know you all use Google to reach everywhere on the Internet, but are you using it properly? Google actually provides a specific syntax for searching which is unknown to the masses. Also known as the Google operators, this syntax can make your Googling much easy and much less frustrating.

It’s specially useful for bloggers since all of us need to keep an eye on the Internet trends. It’s very useful to know how to properly use our most used tool, that is Google.

So let’s waste less time an look at what Google has to offer for us.

How to use Google syntax?

All the search operators described here can be used by putting the operator in the search box followed by the search query. Like to use related: operator, following query will be used

related:"harkuchh.com"

related: Search for related sites

related:"example.com"

related: is used to search for websites which are similar to the website we provide in search box. When we use this operator, Google will search for any information related to the given website from all over the Internet. Google will show websites which have similar content.

link: Search for all pages that link to a particular url

link:"http://harkuchh.com/trick-to-copy-content-from-a-website-with-copy-protector-enabled/"

This operator will search for all the pages that link to the given url.

site: Search within a particular website only

"site:"harkuchh.com" blogging tips

Above query will only search ‘harkuchh.com’ for the words ‘blogging tips’. This is a very useful operator. Just imagine when you need to find a particular post you once seen on a website but can’t find a link to it. It’s one of my most used operators.

Search for an exact phrase or word

When we search for a sentence on Google, it doesn’t just search for that exact sentence. Try searching for

I will become dictator of the world

Google will search for text which have ‘I’, ‘will’, ‘become’ etc anywhere on the page. But if we want to only search for pages which contain the complete sentence “I will become dictator of the world”, we can do it just by putting the whole sentence within quotes. Like this

"I will become dictator of the world"

Exclude something in the results

Sometimes we want that some specific type of results should not appear in the search results. Google provide a special operator just for this purpose.
That is ‘–’.
Yes just that. Putting a ‘–’ in front of any word will show results which do not have that word in them. To make it even better, this work with other Google operators as well.

hello lady how are you -season

Above query if searched without ‘-season’ will show some youtube results about some seasons of some TV program. But running above query will remove those results which have the word ‘season’ in them.

entry.title: Trick to copy content from a website with Copy Protector enabled
entry.content:
Copy protector is a wordpress plugin which is used by many wordpress sites to stop readers from copying the site content. When you visit a site and find it good to share some part of it, this type of plugins irritate us the most. In these cases, you either share the whole page, or you don’t share anything.

There are many such plugins which prevent users from copying partial content from a website. Here we have a solution to this problem.

The solution we are mentioning here work against all plugins which prevent copying content. This means you don’t need to know which plugin is used by the website that is stopping you from copying, following solution simply work against anything.

How do these plugins work?

Although this is not necessary to stop those copy protector plugins, but having proper knowledge is a good thing.

What we see on a web page is HTML content which is styled with CSS stylesheets. HTML and CSS do not offer much programming power to do anything like stopping people from copying content.
But there is a third power on the webpage which is actually used for programming fancy things on a web page. Its called javascript.

Javascript is a web scripting language that run in our browser, which can do many many awesome things. Preventing us from copying is one of them. So if we can somehow disable the execution of javascript in our browser, all those plugins which stop us from copying content will simply stop working.

But how do we do it?

In previous versions of most browsers, one setting was provided to switch off javascript. But not anymore. New browser no more provide this option since more and more websites are becoming javascript heavy and they simply do not work if javascript is disabled.
So we need a third party tool which can disable javascript in the browser.

Browser plugins to the rescue

Most browsers have addons or plugins which we can install in the browser. Various plugins are available to disable javascript in browsers. We can search the browser addon market and find many.

Our favorite plugin for this purpose

No Script

The NoScript Firefox extension provides extra protection for Firefox browsers. It is free and open source add-on which allows JavaScript, Java, Flash and other plugins to be executed only by trusted web sites of your choice. NoScript also provides the most powerful anti-XSS and anti-Clickjacking protection ever available in a browser.
With noscript we can choose which site can execute javascript and which can’t.

So what we actually have to do?

Just install noscript in firefox and follow the tutorial.

Tutorial to copy content from a website with Copy Protector enabled

Okay this is a really small tutorial here.
When you have noscript installed in firefox, there will appear an icon like this in your firefox window.

By default noscript do not allow any site to execute any javascript, java or flash code. So most sites will just stop working the way they usually do.

So first thing we have to do is disable the noscript gloablly.

  • Click on the noscript icon and unselect “Forbid Scripts globally”.

It will show a warning messag saying

“Scripts are going to be allowed globally (for every site). This is a potentially dangerous action. Do you really want to proceed?”

Just ignore it and press ok.

  • Now open the site from which you want to copy content.
  • With that site’s page open, again click on the no-script icon and select “Mark <site-name> as Untrusted”

Doing this will auto-refresh the page and no-scripts will be run from that page. This means none of the copy blocking plugins will work.

So, that’s what we wanted to achieve. If you have any questions and queries, please feel free to ask in comments. We also have forums where you can ask any question and me and our team will try to answer as per our knowledge.

entry.title: How to Optimize your Database from cPanel
entry.content:
To help your website or blog in performance, keeping your database(s) optimized is always a great step. No matter you are using InMotion Hosting, GoDaddy Hosting, Hostgator hosting or any other hosting cPanel account or hosting Account, this can be easily done using phpMyAdmin. Make it sure before optimizing your database all your data backup. You can ”Optimize Table” to reclaim unused space and defregment the data file for optimal performance.  If a lot of changes have been made to a table, optimizing the table can sometimes significantly improve performance.

Steps to Optimize Database tables from cPanel..

  • Log in to your website cPanel.
[caption id=”attachment_9432” align=”aligncenter” width=”394”] Log in to cPanel[/caption]  
  • Click on phpMyAdmin under Databases section.
[caption id=”attachment_9433” align=”aligncenter” width=”580”] Click on phpMyAdmin under Databases section[/caption]
  • Now look at left, you will see your `Database` name on which you’re working on there, just click on it.
[caption id=”attachment_9434” align=”aligncenter” width=”580”] click on Database` name on which you’re working[/caption]
  • Now go down and click on `Check All` it will select all your database tables.
[caption id=”attachment_9435” align=”aligncenter” width=”580”] click on check all to select all tables[/caption]  
  • Click on drop down Menu next to `Check All/Uncheck All` and select `Optimize table`.
[caption id=”attachment_9436” align=”aligncenter” width=”511”] click on Optimize Table[/caption]

This is it, you have done, database of your website has been optimized, if you have any sub-domains or any Add on domains in your account then just do same things (step 3 to 5) to optimize their databases. Database optimization is recommended to do on a regular basis as a preventive measure, it doesn’t take much effort but it do affect a site’s or blog’s performance a lot.

  •  Website Fulfill almost every points mentioned on Program Policies & Terms of Service (TOS).
  • Website or Blog Getting  decent Traffic.

Your website should be according to the Terms and Conditions of Google make it sure there is  no adult content, warez, gambling sites, Hacking and hate spreading contents & Copyrighted Data or post on your website. Be Regular on updating Post try to upload a new post in 3-4 days on your blog  if it’s not possible for you than fix a time interval for uploading posts and follow them sincerely, regularly updating Blogs attracts Google and If they find useful contents on your blog your account will be approved without any problem.

entry.title: Most Common reasons for Disapproval of Google Adsense Application
entry.content:
In blogging many people says that I applied for Ads to the Google, but my application got rejected or whenever I apply for Adsense Ads, Google disapproves my request. Even my requests got disapproved two times before I got approved, but people don’t know, what are the reasons responsible for the disapproval of their Adsense application, Google always mentions some reasons in reply email which are responsible for not accepting one’s Ads application. Here are the some most common reasons for disapproval of your Adsense Application..

1. Too Many Tags or Keywords

You  might know that Tags plays a very important role in improving your page’s visibility in the search engines. Search engines always search for the tags which show what is in your post. Actually these tags are the keywords or the word phrases that people types on different search engines for searching answer of their query. If you don’t know that then must settle this thing in your mind that, you should not give too many keywords in your post, because sometimes written articles are not so informative, but if it contains too many keywords search engines crawls, just because there are many keywords, but Google will not take the post as a healthy webpage, which makes a negative impression of your site to the search engine and Google never approve ads request from those blogs/sites. Tags must be used in the post according to it’s quantity and quality. Using unusual, useless and irrelevant tags with an article reduces your credibility with the search engines and even people who come to see your website will not feel good, just imagine the moment you are searching for something and you open pages shown from search engine but you won’t find anything about the thing you are searching for, I’m sure you will never comeback to that particular site then why someone comes to your. See using irrelevant, useless and inappropriate tags in your post may increase your visitors but Google will not accept your Adsense request, because as a good service provider Google always wants to provide best output to the every person using it.

 2. Lack of Quality Content

You must read this very very carefully, whenever you start writing for you website or any website you must write informative and original content instead of copying someone’s idea before you apply for Google Adsense. As I said Google is the best search engine and as the best service provider Google always looks for content that visitors would love to read from beginning till the end. If your website contains very few articles you will find it really difficult to get approve Adsense account. Atleast in the beginning, prefer to write content that which attaract the attention of readers so that Google consider your application. In your post use titles  and heading that are catchy as well as popular, and never neglect to post genuine and innovative material.and one most important point in article writing is it is better to have text as well as quality pictures in your post and also include videos too, these things make the post more interactive. People love to stay on those pages instead of the webpages that contain only text in post, but it doesn’t mean you use use picture in each of your post, if pictures are not relevant don’t use them.

 3. Presence of Copied Content

People think they can make Google fool but dear this is really a very tough thing to do, so if you are using any kind of copy paste either you stop this or stop dreaming of Adsense ads on your site because Google really hate copied and it’s not so tough for google to figure out copied content in a post or webpage, You may don’t know that but it’s true that by doing this you are harming your prestige in the cyber world. Google uses many algorithms and systems to track any kind copied content or any material easily, and most important by doing this you will disgrace your image in front of your readers. entry.title: Awesome SEO Tricks to Optimize Your Website in SERP
entry.content:
SEO (Search Engine Optimization) is the most critical factor which is responsible for optimizing of any blog or website and make it’s appearance on all the top Search Engine in searched Results which enhance the traffic on your a website. Critical factor which is important here is to get the keywords on which you want the visitors to reach your site through SERP (Search Engine Results Page). Well in case you are new in blogging field then you must need to  be aware of some very basic SEO tips and tricks to improve your website’s ranking in the Search engine results.

Awesome SEO tricks to Optimize Your Website in SERP

Keywords in Title Tag

If you know about this then read this point one time and if you are not familiar with this I will recommend you to read this at least thrice, Title Tag is one of the most important factor to take  your posts on higher level searched results based on Keywords you chosen. This tag gets visible in the clickable link on the SERPs. It is always recommended to to start your title with a long-tail keyword having less competition, you must use Adwords tool for this. Always try to use your Keyword within the range of 65 characters as search engine bots give preference to them, and always try to repetition of Keywords in your posts title otherwise your site could be penalized.

Use Keywords in Header Tags

Header tags are one of the most compelling on-page search engine optimization factors. Try to use the same keywords in all the heading tags by following this simple trick you can easily transfer focus of the page on a single keyword while superiority in search engines. You should better use your main keyword in the first section tag and try to keep the use of keywords in mandatory required way.

Use Keywords in Image Alt tag

I think this point is very much responsible for success of Harkuchh.com and many other blogs on web, Images are best way to express many words, and Search Engine Spiders don’t understand image so it have to translate any images they only read the alt tag with text description to understand the image. Therefore, it is essential to have a substantial description of any image you use in your post on your website. This will surely optimize the images in your content and rank higher in search image.

Use Power of Internal Linking

Never ever make mistake of avoiding internal linking as it’s one of the most significant factor and most of the bloggers specially Newbies often ignore Internal Linking which lead them to failure. The better approach is to reactivate and revitalize the old posts in archive, as compared to link them in your fresh posts. Never ignore the role of internal linking in the distribution of page rank.

Links from Directories

There are so many top Directories over internet which helps the submitted websites and links to get searched on search engines so Planting in directories, like Google’s Webmasters, Yahoo, DMOZ and some other article and content directories can be very helpful to achieve positive ranking and get more searched as well.

Meta Description

Well Google now gives quite less importance to meta tags but still there are two meta tags matter in SEO, Meta description tag are important for both human and search engine perspective. Description meta tag is what you use to illustrate your website. In fact, this description is what visitors see when your site appears in the search results.

Use Keywords Meta Tag

Put your relevant keywords in Keywords tags but take care of avoiding replicas and Keyword stuffing in post, tags or anywhere else. The keywords that you mention in the keyword tag is used to the context of your page are relevant, and the keywords used in meta keywords must be written somewhere in your post or article, if you will not do this by this way your website will be penalized for irrelevant content and it will give you that pain which is not easy to suffer from.

entry.title: Things to Ensure Before Applying for Google Adsense
entry.content:
I have written it many times and writing it again here that `Adsense is the King of all Ad Networks` and reasons are more than enough for this like  it’s payouts CPC (cost per click), CPM, CTR are much higher when compared to other Ads Networks, and off course due to the brand Google, almost every Blogger want Adsense on their Blog. Getting Adsense is not everyone’s cup of Tea, Google is very strict in order to approve Adsense account to any blog or website, there is no place for any mistake you need to follow their Terms and conditions very strictly, even a very small mistake can led to un-approval of your Adsense application. Here is the list of all important things you should ensure before applying for Adsense to Google.

1.          High Level Domain

When we apply for Adsense our site/blog undergoes two reviews, respectively called as Partial Review and Overall review. The first review can be easily surpassed if you have a domain ending  with .com, .org. In former time Adsense used to accept free domains from WordPress and blogspot but in present era Google become more choosy & strict in its selection and give preference to high level domains ( .com, .org) in its first review.  

2.         Strictly Avoid Copy+Paste

Before applying for Adsense must ensure that there is no copied content on your site or blog means you have not copied any post from any website and pasted on our site (most of people do this and later cry for Adsense). If you have any copied content on your website then `Google may surpass partial review but in second review your application will be disapproved for sure`, so if you are really serious about your earnings with Adsense do stick to the original content. If you don’t take it serious then you will get this reply from Google..  

3.         Enough content

Insufficient no. of posts or so called less content also led to disapproval of an Adsense application. Some people will also tell you that `Content doesn’t play a bright role in Adsense approval` but sadly believe me it’s not true at all ! If you believe me, at least 10 posts should be  there before applying for Adsense otherwise be ready to receive this..

4.         Quality and Type of Content

In order to build a good relationship with Google Adsense, Content on your blog must obey rules stated by Google Adsense. Don’t promote any product related to Pornographic, Drugs, weapons or anything degrading nations & religion peace. Google highly give preference to English as main language so you also try to provide content in form it wants. You may have noticed many sites have more than enough content but they have no Adsense, Do you know why ? because of quality and value of their content, and length of posts. A post should be at least of 300 words.  

5.         Age of Applicant

Google wants to deal with Adults not teens i.e. Age plays an important role in Adsense Approval, if anybody is going to applying for Adsense then he/she must be 18 years old. If you are a blogger having blog fulfilling all the Terms and Conditions of Adsense but your age is less than minimum then you can apply for Adsense through email account of any member of family whose age  is 18+. Otherwise you will get this answer from Adsense..  

6.         Easily visible About & Contact Me Page

Many people won’t give their attention towards this but Google does, About page is very essential for Adsense, About page provides info. about the blogger and Blog (the content what your blog contain’s) it creates a bond between you and your readers. If you don’t have About Page on your blog then stop dreaming of Adsense ! Must mention your email address and your name same as that mentioned in the Adsense application this ensure trust that might build Adsense team on you. Along with About Page `Contact Me` Page is also required though which your readers directly interact with you, this will make your good image to Google. Adsense Team will be glad they are working with one, who not only care about Audience but also like to interact with them and Guide them. In short, this helps Google to make a conclusion that you are more interested in building Audience than earning money.  

7.         Blog design or Theme

Always try to make your blog theme as simple as possible, because in creation of a building something big, every small things counted as important part.  Ensure that your blog is quick loading, SEO friendly, simple and easy for use of readers, in easy words let your blog describe what it is all about i.e and let a Gadget Blog looks like a Gadget.  

8.         Different Ad Networks

Adsense allows different Ad networks along with it, but not every ! If you have no Adsense ads on your blog and you running Ads of other Networks and now you thinking of apply for Adsense  then I strongly recommend you to remove current ads or do check whether those ads are allowed with Adsense or not because even a minor mistake might count and become a negative point for your blog. I’m not saying that you stop permanently using other Ads on your blog, You just stop showing other network ads while applying for Adsense and let them off until Adsense team replies about your account acceptance. If Adsense approve your blog for Ads then you can check if those ads are allowed with Adsense or not then make decision of using them and if Adsense reject your application then you can continue with previous Ads.  

9.         Good Traffic

See, Google Adsense is the Ads King so they have millions of pending Ads request, Good Traffic is one of the main thing Adsense team always looks for, they focus at profit to their advertisers, Your dream of having Adsense Ads will be uncompleted until your blog get a good traffic at least 80-100 visitors per day, for more details you must check this post `What is the minimum requirement of Adsense`.  

10.       Paid Traffic

People use some cheap ways to get traffic on their site one of the most common example is ‘Buying Traffic’, but Dear if you have a wish to earn from best Ads Company, you strictly avoid those cheap things because it might led to disapproval of your Adsense application, and yeah don’t think you are smart and you can make Google fool ! Instead there are many ways to get massive traffic to your blog.  

11.        Avoid Shortcuts, use Complete Words & Sentences in Paragraphs

We have already discussed about `Quality and Type of Content` but I also wanted to tell my Readers that you must use proper completed sentences with formation of paragraphs after an interval interval, this is recommended by Adsense and avoiding it’s ‘Content Type’ criteria may led to disapproval of your Adsense application.  

12.        Privacy Policy

You must have Privacy policy on your blog, it gives a Professional touch to your blog. It can mention in any way, you can place this page with Titles ‘Privacy policy’ or ‘Terms and conditions’. Google says you must focus tio provide best service to your audience and all the readers and ignoring this may became a reason of disapproval of your Adsense Application, then why to take a chance. I have discussed all the important points and possible ways and it will help you to get an Approved Adsense for sure, now if you have any confusion, query, or point regarding it, please let me know via comment. It will be like an honor to interact with you. Read this post in Hindi.

entry.title: How To Track IP who Performing invalid Clicks on Adsense using StatCounter
entry.content:
Just 2-3 days back I wrote a guest post for Ammar Ali’s  blog Allbloggingtips with title `Why and How To Protect Adsense Account From Invalid Clicks?` and because I wrote that post so Ammar sir gave me privilege to handle all the comments below that post, when I visited that page next day I saw many comments at the bottom, most of them thanked Author(me) for sharing that useful info but there I noticed almost every person saying `Hey Thanks K.K this is really helpful, I’m also having a serious issue of invalid clicks on one of my websites these days you have given awesome info. kindly also tell us how to detect those IP’s from where invalid clicks are being performed on our blog`, so this post is dedicated to all those bloggers who are keen to know `How to track invalid Adsense clicks using StatCounter`. Every Adsense publisher knows that Invalid Click Activity on Adsense Ads is really a very serious issue which can lead them to a banned Adsense account from Google and painful thing is that that ban remains permanent. Google may knows everything and it can give you result of any query but still it doesn’t provide any tool to detect the IP’s from where Invalid Clicks or Click Bombing have done. So it’s all publisher’s duty to fetch those IP’s to protecting their AdSense account from Invalid Click Activity. Many webmasters and bloggers have lost their AdSense account just because of Invalid Click Activity and their unawareness, but I’m sure you’re aware enough that’s why you are reading this article on Harkuchh.com, so let’s discus how to track the IP address from where you are getting Invalid Clicks on your Ads. You can track every single IP performing clicks on Adsense Ads by using StatCounter, and it’s pretty easy. All you need to do is read and follow the given steps very carefully, must note that You can’t afford to miss any point. Let’s start..

Track invalid Adsense Clicks using Statcounter

1. Create an account on Statcounter by using your permanent email account. 2. After that you’ll need to create a new project for your website which you want to track. Click on Add New Project and in Project url fill your website URL and fill all the required information like, Project Title, Country, Time Zone, etc. Just select Invisible Tracking and you can choose to receive monthly or weekly reports via email.   3. Once you’re done with the previous step, StatCounter will detect the platform of your website and gives you a code with detailed instructions on how to install the stat counter code in your website, just follow the given instruction carefully.

How to Track IP clicking on Ads

Now once you have set statcounter for your website by following the given instructions, you can start viewing all your site related reports within minutes. Now back to the Statcounter Home page. 4. First of all click on your project name (your site) then click on Stats and next then click on Exit Link Activity here you can find all the Links on which your visitors clicked to Exit from your site. You can find date, time, exit link name and also the page on which the exit link was clicked. Exit link means the link by clicking which a user jumps to a new page that might be your Ad or a link to any other website. If you will examine the links clicked you can find how many clicks are performed there on advertisements and also at what time the click was made. So there you get all the clicks performed on your Ads but this information is not enough because still you are far from those IP’s from where clicks are done so let’s move further, look at the opened page you can easily see a Magnifying glass icon before the date in every row of the table. By clicking on that magnifying glass you will get to the page where you can see more detailed information about the visitor who clicked on the link. You can find the IP address of the clicker(s) here along with his location, host name, browser, OS, resolution, ISP, visiting length, and the pages he viewed including the exit link. Now if you use a bit of your awesome brain you can track all the valid as well as invalid clicks on your Adsense Ads. If you find any IP clicked on your Ads many times it simply means you are being click bombed by that IP, then you can disable ads temporarily on your website or remove your website from authorized websites list in Google AdSense, you can also ban the fetched IP for showing your Ads from cPanel of your site. Hey publisher, it is highly recommended that whenever you feel any sudden or suspicious change in your Adsense Account  like sudden increase in Page CTR or many clicks but Zero or very low CPC then your most important task is to detect the location and IP address of the person doing invalid click activity on your Ads. This is highly recommended because in case you unfortunately get banned from AdSense because of invalid activity on Ads, you will have stats which you can use at the time of appeal for your account being reinstated. I hope if your question was how to check someone’s IP or how to find those IPs who are doing froud clicks, this complete tutorial to featch the IP of invalid clicker on Ads will help you to keep your Adsense safe and along with your forever, have a look of my other Adsense tutorials those will be also helpful for you. entry.title: What is Subdomain ? How to Create SubDomain of my Website
entry.content:
Few days back I created a Subdomain of my website and when I advertised it on Facebook one of my friend asked me Hey K.K, How did you created Subdomain of your website then I said to him that it’s very easy, you can we can create sub-domain of your website through cPanel. What is Subdomain ?

Subdomains are the third level domains that are used to organize different types of your web site content. Suppose you have a website on Automobile and now you also want to create a site for Gadgets at that time rather than purchasing a new domain, you can create sub domain using the domain you already own, and by this way you can create multiple site by purchasing only one domain. Same like that I wanted to create a website for career tips then I simply made a subdomain (careerguide.harkuchh.com) of my domain name Harkuchh.com.  

How to Create Subdomain of My Website ?

To create a Subdomain just follow instruction given below..
  1. Log in to cPanel.
  2. click on Subdomains under Domain Section.
  3. Type the subdomain name you want in the box before the domain name.
  4. Click inside the ”Document Root” box and it will auto-fill.
  5. Hit the Create button.
  6. You Will see a message that Subdomain has been created ! Now Go back to cPanel Home. 
 

How to Install WordPress in Sub-domain

After making a Subdomain You must need to install a CMS to work in it, so in order to Install Wordpress Instructions are given below..
  1. Click on Fantastico De Luxe in cPanel.
  2. Now Click on WordPress at left.
  3. Carefully choose Domain in which you want to Install WordPress.
  4. Fill Admin Username and Password in Admin access data section.
  5. Click on Create.
  6. Done ! now open your subdomain Wordpress account and work. :lol:
 Must Check : How to create backup of your blog and site.

Can I delete Subdomain after once created ?

Yes, You can delete is anytime you want from cPanel.

How many Subdomains can I create on one Domain name?

It’s depend on your hosting company, generally 25 Subdomain are allowed with one domain.

Can I Use Different CMS in Subdomains ?

Yes, If you are using Wordpress in main Domain you are free to choose any CMS for subdomain like Wordpress, Jhoomla.

Stupid read the post from starting, all is written.

change in any domain whether it’s main or subdomain can’t effect any other.

entry.title: How to get started with linux
entry.content:
So are you eventually tired of Windows’ crashes and viruses ? I know many who are. It’s simply not worth to keep using a system which can’t even function properly (Windows you hearing me ?). I know you have heard of that Linux thing but never tried. Yes the rumors are true,Linux never crashes, and it never hangs. You don’t even need to press the refresh again and again to keep it working properly. It’s awesomeness in its most raw form. If you are reading this post you are most likely willing to get out of the jail Microsoft has put you in (and they even ask you to pay for it), or you are standing on the line to make the decision to give Linux a shot. If it’s the latter case, here are some features of Linux which should give you the final push.

Stable to its core

As I stated earlier, it’s a solid system. So solid that sometimes I am forced to wonder that even Ambuja Cement is no match for it. You can leave a computer running for a month in a cyber cafe, and even after the month it will be working as fast as ever, without any need of restart or anything at all. Hell, most servers run Linux (that include Google, Yahoo, Facebook and more) and they run literally for years non stop. Try that with your Windows machine ^_^

No viruses ever (god promise)

I can bet on this. Being a power user (and a proud geek) for about three years, I never ever faced a virus in Linux (never even heard of any). This is one thing you gonna miss the most once you start using (or enjoying I would say) Linux. How come Linux has no viruses? Read our previous post on Why virus don’t work on Linux.

No Licenses

Don’t want to pay for your “WINDOWS” anymore? You don’t need to. Linux is all free. You don’t need to pay a single paisa for it, and nobody will ask you to do that. You no more need to live in the fear that if you mistakenly update your windows someday, Microsoft will block your computer. No money? No worries, Linux is all free and open source (if you care about that).

Free Free Free

Almost every software on Linux is free too. Literally each and everyone of these and millions of more.
  • Free Office suite
  • Free Photoshop, Gimp we call it
  • Free Animation Studio
  • Free DJ Studio

Linux is hard to use ?

I heard someone saying that Linux is very hard to use. May be it was in 90’s. But. Wake up Sid, Geek is the new sexy anyway. Although you don’t need to be a geek to use Linux, it’s too sexy man. Remember what Steve Jobs said? You need to think different. Very well then, Follow my lead.

First steps in animal territory

Taste Linux without loosing Windows safe-house (pun intended)

Yup! You can install Linux like a windows program and then if you don’t like it just uninstall it like anything else. It will still be the full blown Linux Operating System, but it will not affect your Windows. No, I am not talking about Virtual Box or VMware. What we are going to do is use a software which will install the Ububtu (most popular Linux) like any windows application.

Here’s how to do the magic

It’s basically the Ubuntu (very famous Linux distribution) which is installed with a program (WUBI) provided by Canonical (people that make Ubuntu)
  • Download the latest Ubuntu iso file
  • Download latest Ubuntu Windows Installer (wubi we call it)
  • Place the .iso file and wubi.exe in same folder and run wubi.exe
  • Then Choose the drive you want to install Ubuntu in
  • Don’t worry, C: will be just fine too. It will not harm your computer in any way.
  • Choose how much space you want to give the new OS (1 GB is enough)
  • Click the magic button (Install I mean)
  • Restart the Computer
  • Then on startup, you will be given two choices like in this screen
  • Make your choice and you are welcome :)

Using Linux

So now we can run Linux easily and play with it like a toy. But what next? Ubuntu has a very straight forward approach, nice looks and slick interface. There is no need of much illustration. Feel free to enjoy it to your heart’s content. Here are some tips and tricks about some new things you gonna find in Ubuntu.

Installing new software

Installing new software in Linux is different from Windows. There are no .exe files or other setups like that which you can use to install software. Yea, that means you no longer need to click those next-next buttons for every software you want to install. Instead there is a software center where you can search for software, read the description about what the software do and install it if you want. The latest version of the software will then get downloaded and installed on your new machine. It’s more like an app store, and much powerful system then Windows’ ‘setup’ approach. We’ll discuss in some other post what’s so amazing about Linux approach of installing software.

Removing software

You guessed it right, the software center. It’s your one stop shop for every new software you want to install or remove.

What if you are offline ?

That’s actually worst than it sounds. There are many problems you’ll face using Linux offline. If you are using a computer which can’t stay online, I recommend not trying Linux on this machine. That is if you are new to Linux world. There are of course solutions to those problems (follow same link given above), but they are kind of hard for Linux beginners.

Watching videos and listening music

You will not be able to listen to music or watch videos on Ubuntu you just installed, lol. Actually you can, but you need to download extra software for that. Why is it like this? Well, it’s because the decoder packages which are used to play music (mp3) and videos are not open source. In order to keep itself completely open and free, Ubuntu do not offer those software in default CD. You need to install them later.

How to do that ?

Simply try to play a mp3 and/or a video and Ubuntu will ask you to download and install some plugins. Click ‘Install’ and get going. It will download about 28-35MB, and here you have the safest machine you can get with little to no effort on your part.

Why should you use Linux ?

If the reasons I gave in beginning of this article were not enough, here are some use cases that may convince you.

To Surf Internet

Which is the safest way to surf the web? There is none. But you can minimize the risk by using Linux. Most bad websites assume you to be using Windows and try to hack using scripts which think exploit several ‘features’(?) of windows. Using Linux means automatic safety from 70% of those bad websites.

Lack of Anti-virus

Are you tired of your antivirus screaming in your face to buy the pro version or singing the songs that its trial version is expired? No virus means no need for anti-virus. Use Linux, the ‘Ram-baan’ for all viruses.

Transfer data from pen drives

If you are like me (and most people I know), there will be lots of times when you will need to use a pen drive (or data card) but you are scared that the pen drive would have virus. Just boot into Ubuntu and use it for all data transfer. Virus don’t spread by itself, it spread only when you open a virus file (which happens automatically when you open a pen drive). Using Linux can save your ass every time you need to use a pen drive. It is not that hard to use Linux as people say. Use this guide to help you, or you can contact me if you have any problem. I will be more than happy to help. Linux is the awesomeness you must not ignore. Even if you need to suffer a little with your first steps towards Linux, it’s worth the fruit you gonna get in the end. Happy hacking :)
